title: Part a. [0–2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

1 point for each correct vector

(If both vectors are reversed from correct directions, then partial credit of 1 point awarded.)
descriptions:
No points earned

1 point for each correct vector

(If both vectors are reversed from correct directions, then partial credit of 1 point awarded.)

Earns 1 of 2 points

1 point for each correct vector

(If both vectors are reversed from correct directions, then partial credit of 1 point awarded.)

Earns 2 of 2 points

1 point for each correct vector

(If both vectors are reversed from correct directions, then partial credit of 1 point awarded.)

title: Part b. [0–6]
stimulusHtml:
6 points (i. 4 points; ii. 2 points)

i. 4 points

Gauss's Law:

∮ E ⋅dA= Q  encl  / ϵ 0     (or 4πk Q  encl  )

1 point:
For r > R, using a Gaussian surface that is a cylinder of radius r and length ℓ :

1 point: ∮ E ⋅dA=E(2πrl)

1 point:

Qenc1=p(πR2ℓ)

E( 2πrℓ )= p(πR2ℓ) / ε0

1 point:

E = ρ R 2 2 ϵ 0 r ( or 2 π k ρ R 2 r )

ii. 2 points

For r < R , using a similar Gaussian surface as above:

1 point: E( 2πrℓ )= p(πR2ℓ) / ε0

1 point: E = ρ r 2 ϵ 0 ( or   2 π k ρ r )

title: Part c. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: for the first correct vector

2 points: for second correct vector

(If vectors are reversed from correct directions or if circular lines of force with counterclockwise arrows shown, then partial credit of 1 point awarded.)
descriptions:
No points earned

1 point: for the first correct vector

2 points: for second correct vector

(If vectors are reversed from correct directions or if circular lines of force with counterclockwise arrows shown, then partial credit of 1 point awarded.)

Earns 1 of 3 points

1 point: for the first correct vector

2 points: for second correct vector

(If vectors are reversed from correct directions or if circular lines of force with counterclockwise arrows shown, then partial credit of 1 point awarded.)

Earns 2 of 3 points

title: Part d. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points

1 point:

Ampere's Law:

∮ B ⋅dl= μ 0     I enc1

where Iencl is the current enclosed by the closed loop of integration (i.e., the current density times the area)

1 point:

For r < R, integrating over a loop of radius r:

∮ B ⋅dL=B(2πr)

1 point:

I e n c l = ( I π R 2 ) π r 2 = I r 2 R 2 B ( 2 π r ) = μ 0 I r 2 R 2  

1 point:

B − μ 0 I 2 π r R 2 ( or μ 0 J r 2 )
